text.__SUMMARY__: Conus lombardii is an extinct species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.
text.Description: The size of the shell attains 29.5 mm. It is similar to Conus kaesleri and Conus spurius
text.Distribution: This marine species of cone snail is known only in the fossil state in the Neogene of the Dominican Republic.
text.References: Hendricks J.R. (2015). Glowing seashells: diversity of fossilized coloration patterns on coral reef-associated cone snail (Gastropoda: Conidae) shells from the Neogene of the Dominican Republic. PLoS ONE. 10(4): e0120924
